Package Enginegames

Class WorldObj

java.lang.Object
Enginegames.WorldObj
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Apple, Button, Tile
public abstract class WorldObj
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tickable
superclass of all objects being able to be added to the world

  • Field Details

    • x

      public int x
      The position of the object

    • y

      public int y
      The position of the object

    • img

      public AdvancedImage img
      The sprite of the Object. If you want to use Buffered images use the AdvancedImage(BufferedImage) constructor

    • world

      public World world
      The world the object is in. May be null, if not present in any world.

      Parameters:

      Throws:

      sets the image to a file location
      Parameters:

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - thrown when there is no such image

    • _mouseEvent

      public void _mouseEvent​(MouseEventInfo e)
      The raw Mouseevent, used to being able to execute stuff, while ensuring it gets called even if the mouseEvent(MouseEventInfo) function is overwritten
      Parameters:
      e - the event caused

    • mouseEvent

      public void mouseEvent​(MouseEventInfo e)
      gets called, when one uses the mouse on the object
      Parameters:
      e - the mouse event called

    • _tick

      public final void _tick()
      Description copied from interface: Tickable
      the super methode, for ticking. this is the one being called every tick. should be final and call the tick() method. This is a way to call functions in super classes without having to be manually called in the objects
      Specified by:
      _tick in interface Tickable

    • tick

      public abstract void tick()
      gets called every tick
      Specified by:
      tick in interface Tickable

    • isAtEdge

      public final boolean isAtEdge()
      checks if the object is at the border of the world

    • oob

      public final boolean oob()
      returns if the actor is out of bounds of the world.

    • isOutOfBounds

      public final boolean isOutOfBounds()
      checks if the actor is out of bounds. requires hardedge to be false.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • getDimension

      public final int[][] getDimension()
      returns the range the object is in.
      Returns:
      the area the object is in, relative to its x and y position

    • getShape

      public java.awt.Shape getShape()
      Returns the hitbox of the Object. Used for collision detection !!if you use custom shapes, make sure to overwrite the isTouching(WorldObj) as well
      Returns:
      the shape of the object

    • isAt

      public final boolean isAt​(int x, int y)
      Checks if the object is at the field x y
      Parameters:
      x - the field x coordinate
      y - the fields y coordinate
      Returns:
      if the object is touching/intersecting the field

    • isAt

      public final boolean isAt​(int x, int y, boolean absolute)
      checks if the object is present at the x and y position
      Parameters:
      x - the x position to check
      y - the y position to check
      absolute - if the coordinates are field positions or frame coordinates
      Returns:
      if the object is interfiering the point

    • isTouching

      public boolean isTouching​(WorldObj o)
      returns if ths object touches the other object
      Parameters:
      o - the object the collision is checked for
      Returns:
      if the two object touch

    • isTouching

      public <T extends WorldObj> boolean isTouching​(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
      returns if any object of the given class are touching
      Parameters:
      cls - the class to check
      Returns:
      if any is touching
